title: COVID-19 national tally reports over 5,000 infected in critical condition
content:
Eighty-four corona patients have died during past 24 hours, 80 of whom were under treatment in the hospitals and four of them perished in their respective quarantines or homes, according to the latest update issued by the National command and Operation Centre (NCOC).
Most of the deaths occurred in Sindh followed by Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP).
Out of the total 84 deaths occurred, 38 of them died were under treatment on ventilators.
There were 5,383 Covid infected patients under treatment in critical condition in various Covid dedicated healthcare facilities of the country.
The National Covid positivity ratio during past 24 hours was recorded 6.43%.
The Covid positivity ratio is the percentage of actual positive cases appearing in every 100 tests performed to identify infected individuals.
The maximum ventilators were occupied in four major cities including Islamabad 38 percent, Bahawalpur 47 percent, Lahore 55 percent and Multan 70 percent.
The maximum Oxygen beds (alternate oxygen providing facility other than ventilator administered as per medical requirement of COVID patient) was also occupied in four major cities of Swabi 77percent, Gujrat 63 percent, Gujranwala 72 percent and Multan 57 percent.
Around 538 ventilators were occupied elsewhere in the country while no COVID affected person was on ventilator in Balochistan and Gilgit Baltistan (GB).
Some 63,161 tests were conducted across the country on Wednesday, including 21,062 in Sindh, 22,902 in Punjab, 11,637 in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP), 4,560 in Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT), 1,249 in Balochistan, 646 Gilgit Baltistan (GB) and 1,105 in AJK.
Around 1,076,112 people have recovered from the disease so far across Pakistan making it a significant count with over 90 percent recovery ratio of the affected patients.
Since the pandemic broke out, a total of 1,194,198 cases were detected that also included the perished, recovered and under treatment COVID-19 patients so far, including AJK 33,037, Balochistan 32,480, GB 10,109, ICT 101,840, KP 166,564, Punjab 408,758 and Sindh 441,410.
About 26,497 deaths were recorded in country since the eruption of the contagion.
Around 7,073 people perished in Sindh, 42 of them died in the hospitals and one out of the hospital on Wednesday.12,135 people died in Punjab with 17 deaths occured in past 24 hours. Some 14 individuals died in the hospitals and three out of the hospitals.
As many as 5,175 people expired in KP, 20 of them died in hospitals on Wednesday, 879 individuals died in ICT, two of them died in the hospitals on Wednesday, 342 people died in Balochistan, 179 infected people perished in GB, and 714 people died in AJK, two of them succumbed to the deadly virus in the hospital on Wednesday.
A total of 18,286,469 corona tests have been conducted so far, while 640 hospitals are equipped with COVID facilities across the country.
Some 5,788 corona patients were admitted to hospitals.
